column1: full and on the pads, uses the wrists to clip it away to midwicket
wide outside off, keeps a tad low and misses the blade of Ghani who slashes and the ball evades the keeper as well as it keeps low
fuller ball, on the pads, clipped out to square leg for one
Shahzad is gone, early blow for Afghanistan. Pays the price for playing across the line. Fullish length and coming into him, plays all across it, overbalances and is trapped in front. Looked plumb
full and outside off, a set of stumps outside off, comes forward and pushes it out to covers
full and on middle and leg, comes on straight, pushes it out quietly to mid-on. No run there
fullish ball, hit on the pads. Was that high? Seems like it. He came across and tried to play across the line, plays all over it and gets rapped in front of off. Hit high on the pad
good length ball, coming into him on leg, stays in the crease and blocks it out
length ball, straightening outside off, hint of some movement, taps it to midwicket where there is a fielder stationed
fullish ball, again straightening a little around off, pushed down the pitch with a straight bat
fuller and angling in, holding its line this time and coming on leg, pushed towards mid-on
on a length and outside off, holding its line, pushed out to covers without much feet

appeal for caught behind. Anil Chaudhary walks over to consult the square leg umpire. Kevin O'Brien is quite confident. They have referred this to the third umpire. This was full and shaping away from Rahmat. He goes after it away from the body, does not move the feet and has to to reach out for it. There is a certain noise and some deviation as well as the ball goes to the keeper. It is a legal delivery and the TV umpire has flashed the red light. Afghanistan once again in early trouble
full and drifting on the pads, glances it late behind square where short fine leg dives to his right to field it
full and on the pads, clipped away through square leg for one
sees some width and slashes hard but the ball is not short enough and he gets beaten outside off
this time it full and wide, not much bounce and it is left alone by the batsman
fullish and angling in, closes the bat face early and squirts out a leading edge that rolls into the off side
drifting in on the pads, tucked away to deep fine leg
fullish and outside off, stays in the crease and keeps it out with a straight bat
on a length, tucked with the inward angle and off the pads to deep backward square leg. There is a deep fine leg who runs across and they run the first one hard to comfortably complete the brace
on to the front foot and drilled out to covers
length and outside off, takes a good stride across and sticks the bat out. He is probably expecting it to angle in again but it holds its line and comes on straight and shoots past the outside edge
full and outside off, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
walks across to cover off-stump and pushes this fullish ball down the pitch, back to the bowler
good, tight line and length, Good length and on off and middle and the batsman knocks it back to the bowler with bat close to pad
full and angling in on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on off the front foot

comes down the track and picks out extra cover. The pressure of lack of run gets to him. It was short of good length and he strides out and slashes a cut. Hits it straight into the hands of Jacob Mulder. Wanted to go over the off side in-field but perhaps did not give himself enough room as a result of stepping down the track
shuffles across and bunts this fullish length ball to mid-off
appeal for lbw. Not given. Short of good length and angling in and raps him on the pads as he fails toflick it away. Probably heading down leg
short of good length, comes down the track and makes an awkward attempt at a pull shot, the ball goes down the leg side
full and wide outside off, stays in the crease and stabs it to mid-off
short of good length ball, defended
advances down the track and the bowler drags the length back. Tries to forcefully whip it away through square leg and ends up wearing it on the body
full and outside off, comes forward and pushes it to mid-off
full and angling in on off and middle, clipped off the toes wide of mid-on, to the right of the fielder there and it beats him though he gives it a solid chase
full and outside off, pushed out to covers off the front foot
full and wide outside off, comes forward and lets it go as the ball holds its line outside off
full and holding its line outside off, very close call for wide as it seems it go over the line. But that part of the line belongs to the umpire
full and angling in on off, comes forward and pushes it to mid-off off the front foot
full and angling in on the pads, turned away to midwicket. No run there

edged and missed by the wicketkeeper. Too close to the body to open the face of his bat as the ball comes in to him sharply. Gets an outside edge and the wicketkeeper misreads it, keeps the gloves inside as the ball shoots past him into the boundary. That was a regulation catch for the keeper
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
full and pushed across the left-hander outside his off-stump. Shahidi shoulders arms
fullish length and pushed across outside off, stays in the crease and stabs it out to point where the fielder makes a diving save. Good stop
on a length, holding its line as it goes from close to off, left alone
good length ball, punched of the backfoot to covers
full and angling across around a set of stumps outside off, left alone
advances down the ground and goes for a big slog over the leg side. But it is a good length ball and he cannot find the middle of the bat as the ball goes to deep midwicket on the bounce
full and wide, caressed along the ground to mid-off
on a length, just outside off, blocked from the crease to the bowler
short of good length and angled in, swivels around and helps it on its way as he pulls it away to deep backward square leg
full and wide, comes forward and crunches a cover drive. Times in brilliantly but cannot pierce the gap at covers
good length ball outside off, hangs back and opens the face of his bat to crunch it square of the wicket
good length outside off, stands tall and punches it to mid-on
full and angling in on off, comes forward and defends off the front foot as the ball goes back to the bowler
on a length and outside off this time, stays in the crease and punches it out to covers
angling in from a length, pushes back and tucks it away off the pads through square leg for one
pitching on leg and angling across from a length, defended
full and angling across outside off, left alone
tossed up on middle, driven back to the bowler. Almost ended up yorking himself in the process
touch short outside off, cracks the cut shot to the cover fielder
tossed up on middle and leg, hint of turn as he nurdles it to short fine leg
swept to short fine again. The bowler appealed thinking it hit the pad, but even there the ball pitched miles outside leg
gets hold of the sweep perfectly this time. Touch short, he gets down on one knee, on top of the bounce and gets the broom out to power it into the deep square leg fence
worked with the spin past midwicket as they jog the single
floats a full delivery across the batsman, who gets a good stride forward and defends with an angled bat to point
crunching cover drive. Aesthetically pleasing, but a pity that it will be just one. There's sweeper cover in place precisely for that stroke
shapes to cut, not much room to work with. Chops it to the man coming in from point
defends the incoming length delivery from the crease
stretches forward and defends with a straight bat
back of length delivery on middle, punched back to the bowler.
poor bowling. Keeper fails to get across in time. The ball spun back in a long way from leg stump to beat everyone.
looks to smash that to cover, but was too full. Thick inside edge to midwicket. Could have so easily chopped on
cuts and misses. Some fizz off the deck, too full as well
too full, eased with the spin to long-off

crunched into the gap at extra cover. Lovely timing but equally good work in the deep from Thompson. Running around quickly to his left, covering nearly 25 yards, and then sliding across to save two runs
rocks back and pulls the short ball to Dockrell to deep midwicket
flatter on off, gets forward and defends
gets forward and smothers the spin
sharp turn. Draws him forward and beats him on the forward push
drifting into the pads, worked behind square for an easy single
turns it with the angle to short midwicket
not to the pitch but he steps out and works it to midwicket again

got to the pitch of the ball and gave it a good old thwack. Deep cover fielder did well to get around to the ball but couldn't push it back in through the slide. Momentum was taking the ball away and he pushed it over. Thompson the man
lunges forward and blocks
short and sliding down leg, paddled past short fine leg
drifting in from wide of the crease, punched back to the bowler
slow turn, touch too short as well, eased off the backfoot to sweeper cover
line wrong. Tossed up outside leg, spins down further to beat the tickle off the pad
gets a long way forward and works it with the spin to the leg side
rocks back, makes room and cracks it to deep cover
too full on middle, deadbats it
drifts this one into middle and leg, spins away a touch. Shahidi defends from the crease
solidly behind the line of that tossed up delivery in defence
draws him forward and then beats him in flight and dip. Shaves past the outside edge
dabs to short cover, looks for a single but is sent back
worked with the angle to long-on. Too full and so he negated whatever turn there may have been
slow turn into middle and leg, worked behind square as they jog the single
sharp turn but it's from way outside off, lets it go
rocks back and cuts to deep point. Too short again
googly that fizzes across, not there for the pull. Mistimed to midwicket
struck on the pad as he looks to work it to midwicket. But the ball would've missed leg stump

this is simply sensational bowling. There's flight, and so he's drawn forward. But in the process, he fails to account for the turn. Goes for the drive, the ball beats the inside edge by sneaking through the gap and onto the stumps. A wicket any lespinner would be proud of. He looked compact for large parts but one major error of playing down the wrong line has cost him big. Afghanistan in trouble.
drifting into middle and leg, turned to square leg
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, turned to the leg side again
gets outside the line of off and blocks
too full for the cut, squeezes it somehow wide of cover. Loaded with risk, that stroke
drops it to short cover, look for a single but the fielder is quick to get to the ball
thick inside edge to the leg side as he plays outside the line. The ball drifted in to roll off the inner half of the bat
thick edge that flies past first slip. Looked to knock the cover off the ball. Not much feet movement, simply threw his bat at that and got away. No chance for short third man. Lucky runs
short ball and punished. Rocks back and pulls him into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket. Two bounces into the ropes. Used the depth of the crease well
eased with the spin to the cover fielder
opens the face of the bat to steer it wide of cover
beaten by the fizz. This one pitched at length outside off and went straight on. Keeper fumbled too, bye taken as a result
beaten. Ripper of a delivery. Played back to a full delivery that gripped and spun away from off stump.
beaten by one that holds its line. Played forward but inside the line of the delivery
lunges forward and blocks
eased with the spin to long-on as they jog the single
too full outside off, he stretches forward and keeps that out
crashed into the deep extra cover boundary. Took the spin out of the equation by getting right to the pitch and then freeing his arms to hammer it past the diving fielder
straightens from middle, right behind the line as he pats it back to the bowler
beats the outside edge as it spins away.
cuts hard through the off side to the sweeper cover.
tossed wide and plays with soft hands to the off side for a single.
pitches and straightens and strikes the pad, Naib was confused whether to play or let it go, loud appeal and given.
drives well along the ground to the sweeper on the off side.
punches through the off side to the sweeper.
nudges to short fine leg.
defended watchfully to the off side.
spins down the leg side and signaled wide.
moves back and cuts hard to the sweeper cover.
waits in the crease and pushes to the onside.
comes forward and defends to the off side.
driven down the ground to long on for a single.
moves back and works to the onside.
inside edges onto the pads and a stifled appeal.
works to the onside.
sliding down the leg side.
driven down the ground to wide long off.
wayward down the leg side.
defended down the track.
comes forward and defends, gets an inside edge onto the pads.
driven down the ground to long on.
tossed wide and comes forward to defend.
tossed up and Stanikzai goes after it and hits it down the ground to long on and the fielder is waiting there to grab it, Balbirnie takes the catch.
loud appeal first ball, strikes the pad as he looks to play it to the onside, plays down the wrong line. Afghanistan in deep trouble as they are 83 for the loss of 7 wickets.
hit firmly and down the track and down the ground to the fence, that is good positive start.
punches to the off side for a single.
nurdles it down fine for couple of runs.
sweeps past the short fine leg fielder to the fence.
defends down the track.
misses the sweep and the keeper too misses it, goes to the fence for more runs.
pushes back down the track, almost a leading edge.
sweeps this time straight to the fielder at short fine leg.
comes forward and defends.
sweeps and misses, strikes the pad outside the line of the off stump.
pushes along the ground to the sweeper cover.
cuts well past the fielder behind the wicket to the fence, deftly done.
works to the onside.
takes it off his stumps and plays it behind the wicket on the onside.
comes forward and defends.

squares up the batsman, pitches in line with the off and middle stump and spins across to beat the bat, the keeper misses it and goes for byes, coming back for a tight second run, the throw from Murtagh strikes the stumps at the batsman's end, Shafaq gets in.
blocked on the track.
driven firmly to the off side to extra cover.
sweeps to the fine leg fence for a boundary, poor bowling this, gifting runs to the batsman.
plays down the ground to long off.
pushes back to the bowler.
strikes the pad as it spins in, could be a bit high.
sweeps hard to the square leg fence.
pushes back to the bowler.
plays to the onside.
works gently to the onside for a single.
plays back to the bowler.
beats the bat as it spins across the face off the bat.
comes forward and blocks it.
defends to the off side.
sweeps well to the backward square leg fence.
defends to the off side.
moves back and works it forward of square leg.
another single to the onside.
punches it back down the track.
comes forward and defends to the off side.
works it behind square leg.
plays forward and gets an edge onto the pads and lobs up to the onside.
goes for the slog and misses it.
tossed wide and spins away, beats the bat.
tossed wide once again.
too short and pulled wide of long on, the fielder slides across to field it and pass it to the fielder.
defends to the off side.
tucks it away through the vacant midwicket.
punches down the ground to long on.
sweeps well in the air to the backward square leg fence for a boundary.
works to the onside.
tucks it around the corner behind square leg for an easy single.
moves back and across and defends to the off side.
pushes it back to the bowler.
dabs it behind the wicket on the off side.
slogs well to the midwicket fence for a boundary.
too short and a terrible delivery, rocks back and pulls well to the midwicket fence.
comes forward and blocks it to the off side.
too wide outside the off stump.
this time fires in a quicker delivery and left alone.
lovely delivery and Shafiq is struck on the pad in line with the off stump as he moves back to a straight delivery, clever bowling.
defends to the off side.
defended to the off side.
moves back and punches to the off side to extra cover.
comes forward and defends to the off side.
driven well down the ground to long off for a single.
comes forward and defends with an angled bat to the off side.
cut hard to the sweeper cover for a single.
driven to the off side.
plays square of the wicket on the off side for a single.
defended watchfully to the onside.
punches it back to the bowler.
lovely delivery spins across the face off bat, appeal for a catch, turned down by the umpire.
plays to the off side.
defended with a straight bat to the off side.
misses the slog shot.
punches to the off side to extra cover.
comes down the track.
defended to the onside.
sweeps well, a productive shot for Afghanistan, to the backward square leg fence.
punches down the ground to long off and brings up the 150 for Afghanistan.
turns away and lets it go.
cut hard to the off side.
hits in the air down the ground to wide long on.
pushes to long on for a single and that is drinks.
comes forward and defends.
too short and pulled to deep square leg.
defended to the bowler.
works it behind square leg.
driven back in the air and hits the non-striker on his arm.
plays to the onside for a single.
defended to the off side.
punches to the off side to extra cover.
plays with an angled bat square of the wicket on the off side.
comes forward and defends down the track.
driven through the off side to the sweeper cover.
driven down the ground to long off.
driven back past the bowler.
blocked to the off side.
inside edges to the onside and a quick single, overthrows.
blocked to the off side.
punches straight back to the bowler.
driven down the ground to long on.
comes forward and drives to the sweeper cover.
plays back down the track.
works to the onside.
plays back down the track once again.
hit well over the bowler and straight down the ground and over the fence.
almost gives a return catch to the bowler.
defends to the onside.
works it behind square leg to the deep.
turns away to the onside.
gets an inside edge behind the wicket on the onside.
comes forward and plays square of the wicket on the off side.
moves back and punches through the off side.
driven firmly down the ground to long off.
defends to the off side.
defends once again to the off side.
punches to the off side.
plays through the off side for a single.
punches it to the onside.
reverse sweeps well to the third man fence.
driven down the ground to long on.
punches to the off side to extra cover.
comes forward and defends to the off side.
plays to the off side for a single.
works it along the ground to deep midwicket.
short ball and pulled to deep midwicket.
inside edges onto the pads.
cuts hard through the off side.
pushes in the air through point and picks up a single.
dropped. Hit flat and in the air to wide long on and Joyce dives across and fails to hold on, goes to the fence for a boundary.
works to the onside.
defends back to the bowler.
defended.
works to the onside.
works it through square leg and picks up couple of runs,
pushes to mid-off for a single.
cuts and misses, through to the keeper.
driven down the ground to long on.
launches it in the air to deep extra cover and picks up more runs.
full toss hit in the air to deep backward square leg and taken by Thompson.
inside edges onto pads and rolls and misses the stumps.
blocks to the off side.
pushes to the off side to mid-off.
rolls along the ground, keeps very low, plays to the onside.
punches down the ground to long off.
defended back to the bowler.
once again defended back to the bowler.
digs it out to the off side for a single, brings up the 200 for Afghanistan.
plays through the off side to the sweeper.
too wide outside the off stump.
once again too wide.
left alone.
full toss hit down the ground to long off.
defended back to the bowler.
down the track and pulls in the air to deep midwicket.
lovely shot in the gap to the extra cover fence.
hit down the ground to long off.
down the track and launches it well in the gap to the midwicket fence for a boundary.
moves across his stumps and looks to be cheeky, can't get past the short fine leg fielder.
pulls to deep square leg for a single.
massive hit down the ground over the long on fence into the stands.
short ball and Hamza gets a faint edge to the keeper, after he looked to pull.
comes forward to this length ball and bunts it into the off side
pitched up outside off, drilled off the front foot into the covers region
hangs back and opens the face of his bat. Not much room and he gets beaten
stays in the crease to this length ball outside off and drills it back to the bowler
advances down the ground and takes it on the full before pushing this fullish ball down to long-on
sliding in on middle and leg, defended down the pitch off the front foot
fullish on middle and off, defended from the crease
full and wide outside off, pushes it off the front foot into the off side
on a length, pitching on leg and angling away, defended from the crease
full and straight on the stumps, defended from the crease
on a length, on middle and off, defended from the crease
full and wide outside off, wants to drive and skews it off the inside edge into the leg side
on a length on middle and leg, blocked from the crease
sliding in with the arm on a fullish length on leg, clipped away to midwicket
advances down the track to take this on the full before drilling it out to covers
gets dome turn. Fullish length and Stirling comes forward and pushes. The ball spins to take the outside part of the bat and goes square of the wicket on the off side
and this time it comes on with the arm on leg stump line, no turn and it takes the inside edge
short of a length, waits for it to come on and tucks it to midwicket off the pads
full and straight on off, driven off the front foot to covers
walks outside the crease and this one is angling into him, pushes awkwardly away from the body towards mid-on
good length ball, comes down the track and pulls this away to deep fine leg
full and angling across, holding its line around a set of stumps outside off. Joyce crunches a drive and a misfield at extra cover allows them to take the run
shuffles across the stumps to this length ball before whipping it away to deep fine leg
fullish length on leg and middle, keeping slightly low, pushes it to the left of the bowler. No run there
loopy fullish ball on off and middle, comes down the track and eases it down to long-off
pushed a long way across and he sees the room available before coming down the track and launching it straight for four
comes down the track and walks across to try and flick it away. But the bowler makes the adjustment in line and cramps him for room, hits him on the pad but seems like the impact was outside off
gets down to sweep. Shouts of catch it but he has worked it wide of the square leg fielder
full and on the pads, clipped away to midwicket
full on leg stump, coming on straight and holding its line, clipped away through midwicket

full and wide outside off, sees the room on offer there and opens up his arms. Slaps it away wide of the body, off the toe end of the bat as he had to reach out but he has hit that with some power and pierced the packed cover region
full and slightly shaping away outside off, again fails to get to the pitch of it as he slashes away from the body and gets beaten for it
Shahzad makes a feeble appeal and Stirling is annoyed with himself. That's a loose shot. Gets beaten outside off again
good length ball, angling in, hangs back and opens the face of his bat to run it down to backward point
full and wide, pushed on the up to point
full and wide outside off, comes forward and drives it out to covers
tries to slow down the pace and bowls a full toss that is driven out to mid-off who fumbles the gather
short of a length ball and that is a flat six. Brute power. Susses out the bounce early and picks the length to be able to get in position and swat a pull over deep midwicket
appeal for caught, not given. Straightening from a length and beats the flashing blade of the batsman. Shahzad goes up in appeal and seeing him the bowler also goes up in appeal
full and outside off, comes forward and creams a driven to covers
full toss, gleefully accepts it and heaves it over the midwicket region. The ball lands on the bounce and crosses the boundary
scoring opportunity missed. Full and sliding down leg, looks to flick but the ball tickles the pad on its way to the keeper
too full on leg stump, tucked to square leg as they jog the single
leg-cutter this time. Deviates away a wee bit from length to beat Stirling's forward push
opens the bat face late to steer the full delivery into the third man boundary. Cleverly done
walks down the pitch and shows the full face of the bat to keep out that full delivery
this is simply gorgeous! Walks into the drive and crashes it all along the ground to sweeper cover
comes down the track and clips it with the turn. But he plays uppishly. Shouts of catch it and the ball lands just in front of mid-on
comes down the track to smother the spin but the ball is angling in. He misreads the line and wears it on the pad
did that go off one of the cracks? Draws the batsman forward with a length ball that spins away sharply and bounces to beat the outside edge
fullish ball, clipped off the pads to midwicket
oh beautiful use of the feet. He is decisive is coming forward to the spinners, gets on top of the it by getting to the pitch and carts it over mid-on
comes forward early and the ball spins away to go off the outer part of the bat to point
offers up too much width. Fired wide of the crease and though it angles in, it spins away sharply give him the room to slap it away, pierces the gap between the two fielders around the point region
shuffles back and tucks this with the angle behind square on the leg side

chipped straight to mid-on. And it is a huge, huge blow for Ireland. Paul Stirling, the in-form batsman, gets off to a start and perishes. Comes down the track and the ball stops on him a little, as a result he ends up closing the bat face early and gets a leading edge
edged and falls short of slip. Hurries him with pace and gets it to turn quickly, Porterfield sticks the bat out in the channel outside off, went at it with soft hands, so the edge does not carry
too full and on the pads, clipped away to mid-on
flat and full outside off, comes forward and knocks it back to the bowler off the outer part of the bat
full and on the pads, on leg stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
good length ball, pitching on leg and angling away, hangs back and opens the face of his bat to run it away to third man. Fifty up for Ireland
full and on leg stump, stays in the crease and knocks it into the on side
full and angling away outside off, crunched off the front foot to mid-off
driveable length again, on to the front foot is Porterfield and he hits it straight to mid-off
yorker outside off, jams the bat down and digs it out to mid-off
flat and on a length, plays for the angle and the ball spins past the outside edge and misses off-stump very narrowly as well
fuller ball outside off, takes a good stride forward and drives it down to long-off
very full on off and middle, eased down to long-off for one
flat and slower through the air, plays for the turn which is non-existent. The ball comes on with the arm and takes the inside edge
front foot defence into the off side
flat and full outside off, gets across and keeps his bat inside the line as he lets it go to the keeper
full and on the pads, clipped away to deep fine leg
full and wide outside off, angled across, defended into the off side off the front foot, with bat close to pad
width outside off, cracks a drive to long-off
fullish, expects it to angle away but the ball comes with the arm and does not drift away as much. Goes off the inside edge of the blade into the leg side
width outside off, slashes at it and works it out to sweeper cover
fullish and on leg stump, knocked back to the bowler
flat and drifting down leg, short of a length, gets down to sweep but it is not full enough. And the ball is drifting down leg. They appeal for leg before but it missed the pad
fullish, presses forward and drives it out to long-off
punched to covers from the crease
pitches it up and draws the batsman forward, he defends off the front foot into the off side
comes in with the angle and does not turn like he had expected it to, taken by surprise is Joyce and he manages to nudge it away into the on side for one
driven off the front foot just wide of mid-off who dives to make the save

through the gate. Naib pierces Joyce's defence. Straight ball, sticks the bat out, probably expecting it to angle away from him. Ends up leaving a gap between bat and pad. The ball sneaks through and disturbs the stumps
fuller ball, more than a set of stumps outside off, shaping away further sharply late, left alone by the batsman
full and angling in, straightening late, and has he got an edge there? Shahzad gathers it one-bounce and the reaction seems to suggest it was an edge that did not carry
no movement of the feet from Balbirnie who gets it away off the splice of the bat to point as he comes forward and walks into the shot
fullish length ball, defended back to the bowler
fullish outside off, squeezed out to point

turn outside off and Shahzad reckons he has had him stumped. This has been referred to the third umpire. He was pushing forward and dragged the backfoot outside the crease as the ball beats the outside edge. He slides it back in but not before Shahzad whips off the bails in a flash. That wicket was as much the keeper's as much as it was the bowler's. Superb effort all-round
pitched up on the stumps, nudges it towards short leg from the crease
full and outside off, crunches a drive to sweeper cover off the front foot for one
flat and on a length, wants to open the bat face and steer it away, gets beaten
on the pads, turned away to short fine leg
full and straight on off, defended off the front foot down the pitch
fuller on off and middle, drilled down to mid-on
full and wide outside off, punched off the front foot to short cover
good length ball, keeps a bit low, uses his wrists to tuck it away to the right of midwicket
fuller, on off, driven off the front foot
on a length and angling in, stays in the crease before tucking it away to midwicket
on a length and angling in, clipped away off the pads through square leg. Nobody guarding the boundary there and he will get four for it
hangs back and sticks his bat out as the ball spins away from a length, gets beaten for his troubles
pitched up ball, swept away to deep backward square leg
full and straight on middle, defended off the front foot
flat and on a length, pushed uppishly to covers

in the air and safe. Sliding in with the arm and he closes the bat face early as he looks to clip it away, gets a leading edge as the ball goes just wide of extra cover and drops short of the long-off fielder running in
fuller ball on leg, driven down to long-on for one
good length ball, angling in, tucked away to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched solidly from the crease in front of covers, between cover and mid-off
good length on off, opens the face of his bat late and runs it towards short third man. Kevin O'Brien wants the single but is sent back by Balbirnie
pushes it off the front foot back to the bowler and walks down a step or two. Dawlat picks it up and hits the stumps with a throw but the batsman has made it back
short of a length ball, tries to fetch a pull from outside off but there is not enough bounce on it and the ball goes to fine leg off the under edge
angling in on the pads, clipped away to backward square leg where there is a fielder guarding the boundary, so he will keep it to one
sliding in on middle and leg and spinning away, defended. Shahzad runs across to gather it and clutches his right thigh
comes forward and taps this gently through covers for one
fuller ball, gets down and sweeps behind square where short fine leg dives across and prevents what would have been a boundary
defended back to the bowler
on a length, comes half forward and sticks the bat out. Sharp turn results in the ball beating the outside edge
fullish, swept through square for one
full, on leg, clipped through square on the leg side
angling in from a fullish length outside off, comes forward and pushes it into the off side
full and angling in, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
full, on middle and leg, pushed down to mid-on who runs across in a hurry and picks it up
short of a length and cutting back in slightly, opens the bat face and works it to point
offers up a full toss that the batsman gleefully accepts as he comes forward and caresses it through extra cover for four. The fielder dives but the ball gets away from underneath him
gives it too much air and bowls a full toss that is pushed out to sweeper cover
full and outside off, pushed out to sweeper for one
shuffles across and lets this go outside off
comes forward to this length ball and it turns and bounces. Lets it go
goes inside-out and what a shot that is. Loopy delivery on middle and leg, makes room for himself and carts it with the turn over extra cover as the ball goes one-bounce over the ropes
defended towards the bowler off the front foot
backs away and stabs this length ball away to sweeper cover

edged and missed. Loopy fullish ball, flighted and angling in on middle, draws the batsman forward and he gets an edge with the ball dipping on him that goes between keeper and slip who dives to his left. But that was Shahzad's catch, goes to the right of his glove. Misjudges it
tucked into the leg side off the backfoot
opens the face of his point to drop it in the gap at point and takes a quick single
loopy flighted ball, on leg, pushed down to long-on
pushed through on leg, works it away through midwicket
left alone outside off
gets down to sweep and picks out short fine leg
flighted and full on leg, comes forward and turns it away to short fine leg
loopy fullish ball, on leg, drills it out through the off side after coming forward
gets down to sweep and it is too full, he cannot find the middle of the bat as it goes to square leg
full on middle from around the stumps, squeezed to point
swept from outside off towards deep square
beauty! Drifts in and then spins away sharply. He looked to work it to the leg side, only to see the ball spin past the face of the bat
uses the width to ease the short ball to point
works the in-drifter to mid-on for a quick single
down on one knee as he sweeps that incoming delivery with the angle to deep square. Wanted the second but Wilson wasn't keen and put his hand out almost immediately after completing the first run

this one keeps low and sneaks through his defence. The ball drifts in from wide of the crease, pitches on off and skids straight on. Balbirnie was looking to work it with the turn when there was none. Couldn't do much really as the ball didn't bounce enough. Bat didn't come down on time either. Big, big wicket. He was a split-second late on the shot as well.
driven firmly with the spin to cover
gets forward and defends that incoming delivery with soft hands
tossed up outside off, eased to wide long-off
too short, he rocks back and punches it to sweeper cover
squeezed straight to point
full outside off, he stretches forward and blocks
half-tracker and put away. Pulls him from outside off into the gap between deep square and wide long-on. Poor ball
excellent leave. Floats this full just outside off, deviates away a wee bit. Left alone
the sweep again, this time hit straight to deep square leg
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it to long-off
drifts one into middle, bunted back to the bowler
lunges forward and blocks
opens the face of the bat late to squeeze it to the left of point
gets behind the line of the delivery in defence. This was fired into the stumps from wide of the crease
skidder on middle, pushed to midwicket
on the flatter side, stretches forward and defends
pushed through quicker, he drops it gently to the man coming in from short cover for a quick single
stuck outside the line of the stumps as he looks to sweep. Big appeal. Umpire Anil Chaudhary firm in his decision
slow turn and bounce from off stump, guided to point
spins away from off stump, defended
leading edge, but safe. Looked to work the in-drifter but it cut away late from middle stump
whipped into the gap a midwicket, back easily for the second. The boundary rider took a while to get off the blocks
appeal, but a stifled one. Googly this time, looked to whip it away but the ball would've missed the stumps. Came back in sharply from off. Umpire indicated an inside-edge a well
driven through the line to deep cover
worked with the angle to long-on. The short midwicket fielder couldn't slide across in time to cut that off
beaten by sharp turn. Played forward but the ball drifted in and spun away late to whizz past the edge
old-fashioned slog. But played too early. Beaten. Looked to hit it over deep midwicket but very risky to do that across the line
fired into middle, this keeps a touch low but he somehow keeps that out
driven confidently into the gap at extra cover. Too much flight
swept with the spin to deep square leg
pushed outside the line. The ball cut back in to shave past the inside-edge. Phew, so close to the off stump

this time he's got his man. Foxed him completely in length. Thompson feels for the ball, I suspect he was expecting a googly and so pushed outside the line. There was a big gap between bat and pad. This ball spun back in to sneak through. Created the doubt and then finally nipped it in the bud. Skillful from Rashid. Ireland in trouble
gets back and across, short ball defended back to the bowler

beat everyone. Batsman done in by sharp turn, keeper wasn't sure which way it was going. Spun back in and bounced more than keeper expected. Made worse by the fact that it deflected off the batsman's flap of the pad
driven back past the bowler for a comfortable single
eased behind point, the fielder dives full length to his right but can only half-stop it, and so has to run all the way back to the boundary to pull it back in
fired into middle and leg, worked with the angle towards acres of open space at deep midwicket. Bowler runs all the way across to stop that
lunges forward and blocks
gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin

beauty! Once again foxed by the turn. Had no clue if this would spin away as he prodded forward half-heartedly and saw the ball drift-in, straighten and hit off stump. Played down the wrong line again. Fourth for Nabi. The series is fast slipping for the Irish.
fired into middle, he gets forward and defends
whipped from outside off to deep midwicket
short on middle, keeps low, somehow manages to get some bat on it as it rolls past midwicket
gets the bat well in front of the pad as he defends
went across the stumps a long way to sweep but played too early
sharp turn back in from outside off, hit on the pad. Completely bamboozled again
picks the googly off the hand this time, worked to deep midwicket

too short, he rocks back and pulls him into the deep midwicket boundary. One bounce into the ropes. Sitting up nicely for him to put it away, which he did. Had too much time to play it where he pleased.
edged and it races away past short third man. Played it deliberately, guided it late past slip
touch short, whipped to deep midwicket
drifting down leg, swept straight to short fine leg
gets forward and defends that in-drifter
clean hit, lofted through the line into the deep cover boundary. One bounce over the ropes.
slider into middle and leg, worked to midwicket for a quick single
play and a miss. This one was pushed through quicker
swung away and it sails way over the ropes at deep midwicket. Too full, he got underneath the flight and clobbered that
whipped one bounce into the deep midwicket boundary. Too short, he rocks back, uses the depth of the crease and brings those powerful wrists into the picture
not even the presence of a fielder at long-off dissuaded him from going over the top. Flat hit, one bounce to the fielder there
fumble by the keeper and the ball beats short fine leg to the boundary. Handy runs. Drifting down leg, shoddy effort by Shahzad
touch short on middle, punched to deep midwicket
touch short on middle, eased to deep cover
slides back in quickly onto middle, punched to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
defended gently to short cover as they scamper a quick single
fired full on middle from around the stumps, blocked
fired full on middle from wide of the crease, defended gently again
driven with the spin to wide long-off
cracking hit. Into the grass banks at deep midwicket.  Gets underneath the flight and swipes him. What muscle. That would have been six on any ground in the world
drifting down leg, swept too early. Hit on the pad. Could have well helped it on its way
eased with the spin to point
dabbed gently to the man coming in from point. Clever single
gets forward and defends the full delivery to the off side
punches a delivery from length, back to the bowler
thick inside edge to short fine leg, good work by the fielder there
keeps a touch low, punched to long-on nevertheless
big appeal for lbw but the ball spun back in a long way. Bit of inside edge on that as well
swept from outside of to square leg
worked with the spin to long-on, sensible stuff
full on middle from wide of the crease, defended back to the bowler
tucked to short midwicket as they jog the single. Too easy
turned across the line but good work by mid-on to swoop in quickly
swing and a miss. Mid-on was in, looked to heave across the line and missed it
connects this time, although long-off comes around to cut that off. Risky second, no communication between the batsmen but they somehow complete the second run
looks to force that through the off side, gets an inside-edge to square leg
full delivery angling in, hit on the pad as he look to work to the leg side. Appeal but the ball tailed in and would've missed the stumps.
length ball outside off, eased to point
nips away off the seam from length on middle, defended with a straight bat to mid-on
chances a single to short fine, fielder fires a throw to the striker's end, back in however
dabs gently to the off side. Bowled that off the back of the hand
full on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
muscles the pull into the deep midwicket boundary. Valiant effort but there was too much power. Too short and he picked the length early
slower and fuller outside off, he gets forward and blocks
looks to pull but cramped for room. Thick edge back onto the pad as he tried to attempt a short-arm jab
clobbered and almost carried to the fielder in the deep. One bounce to deep midwicket. Shafiq the fielder there.
floated full outside off, driven to extra cover
short and wide outside off, forces one off the back foot to point. Took a while to reach him
width and driven square to the man in the deep
slower delivery on middle, punched to cover
too short and outside off, directed behind square on the leg side

big appeal for caught behind, but the umpire isn't interested. This was full outside off, he had room and tried to carve that over point. Very close, but don't think there was a nick. Keeper wasn't entirely convinced, but the bowler was dead sure this was out. There was a sound but it may be that of the bat hitting the ground
worked down the ground to long-on
sliding into the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
short outside of, punched to deep cover
not all that short to cut, gets a thick bottom edge to third man

full and tailing into middle, driven to mid-off as he scampers a run to bring up a half-century. Couldn't have asked for a better time to rise to the occasion. Innings of character and fortitude. Was injured, came out to bat under pain and has rescued his side
squeezes the full delivery back to the bowler
rocks back to cut but was no position as he was cramped for room. Chopped to the keeper
high full toss which he looked to swing to the leg side, bat face turned and so he got a leading edge that went on the bounce to cover. Should've been called no-ball, was over the waist clearly

holes out to the lone man at deep midwicket. Poor ball. It was too short, he could have played it wherever he pleased. This time, he hit it straight down the throat of the fielder. The ball may have skidded on a touch to prevent him from playing it behind square. Afghanistan are still alive.
fired full outside off, he gets half-forward and defends
drifts in and then squares him up a touch on middle, somehow defended
gets fully forward and defends the full ball on middle
nearly chopped on. The ball skid back in to nearly sneak through off the inside-edge
gets well forward and defends to cover
misfield at long-off concedes a second run when it should have been just a single
bunts the length ball to the right of point for a quick single
punches the length ball to sweeper cover
appeal for lbw but the ball would've gone over. The length ball nipped back in to hit him high on the left pad.
slower and fuller outside off, squeezed to the man at the edge of the ring at cover

bursts through the hands of short third man. There was width, he looked to hit over point, but the ball flew off the edge. Usman Ghani was late to move but did well to cover ground and get to the ball but couldn't hold on
too full and down leg, tickled to deep fine leg
opened the bat face late to steer the short ball to deep point, sensible stuff to bring the senior partner back on strike
goes for an expansive drive, gets a thick inside edge that beats short fine leg. Fist pumps in the Ireland camp. They won't mind how these runs come
appeal for lbw but the ball came back in a long way. He was also a long, long way forward
looks to go over cover, thick inside edge to deep midwicket
slower delivery that cuts away from length, defended gently back down the pitch
nurdles a short ball wide of square leg
gloves a steep bouncer behind square on the leg side
short on middle, pulled into the big gap between deep square and wide long-on. Scores level
as easy as they come. Full toss sliding into the pads and he's flicked that imperiously into the square leg boundary. The series is now level at 2-2.
